value: <l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">7</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">against the past. There is too much comfort now; <del hand="typewriter">too many</del></l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">xmxmxx the pillow has taken the place of the old log with</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">a dip in the middle; there are too many 
            <choice>
              <sic>chimenys</sic>
              <corr>chimneys</corr>
            </choice>. The young</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><rs type="person" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#wsha" key="Shakespeare, William">
            <choice>
              <sic>Shakspres</sic>
              <corr>Shakespeares</corr>
            </choice></rs> and <rs type="person" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#cmar" key="Marlowe, Christopher">
            <choice>
              <sic> arlowes</sic>
              <corr>Marlowes</corr>
          </choice></rs> are not the men their fathers were.</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">They are tender and subject to rheumatism. Also</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">they dress most 
            <choice>
              <sic>fantasically</sic>
              <corr>fantastically</corr>
            </choice> 
            <choice>
              <sic>com ared</sic>
              <corr>compared</corr>
            </choice> with 
            <choice>
              <sic>theirancestors</sic>
              <corr>their ancestors</corr>
            </choice>.</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">He does not see the mummers and the wassailers;</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">he does not hear the voice of <rs type="person" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#psn-anon" key="Anon">Anon</rs>; he 
            <choice>
              <sic>scracely</sic>
              <corr>scarcely</corr>
            </choice> listens even</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">to the song of <rs type="person" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#psn-gcha" key="Chaucer, Geoffrey">Chaucers</rs> Canterbury pilgrims. <add hand="ms" place="above">For </add>The English</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">past as <rs type="person" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#psn-whar" key="Harrison, William">Harrison</rs> saw it, served only to show up the material</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">change--the change that had come over houses, 
            <choice>
              <sic>furnt iture</sic>
              <corr>furniture</corr>
            </choice></l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">clothing. There was no English literature to show up the</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">
            <choice>
              <sic>chnage</sic>
              <corr>change</corr>
            </choice> in the mind. <add hand="ms" place="above">the English songs were [illeg.]</add> Anons song at the back door was as</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">difficult 
            <choice>
              <sic>cfor</sic>
              <corr>for</corr>
            </choice> him to spell as for us. But the old</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">
            <choice>
              <sic>Eglish</sic>
              <corr>English</corr>
            </choice> songs were more painful. for they reminded him of</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">his lack of intellectual 
            <choice>
              <sic>ancstry</sic>
              <corr>ancestry</corr>
            </choice>. His intellectual pedigree</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">only reached back to <rs type="person" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#gcha" key="Chaucer, Geoffrey">Chaucer</rs>, to <rs type="person" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#psn-wlan" key="Langland, William">Langland</rs> to <rs type="person" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#psn-jwyc" key="Wycliffe, John">Wycliffe</rs>.</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">In order to have 
            <choice>
              <sic>anscetors</sic>
              <corr>ancestors</corr>
            </choice> by way of the mind he must cross</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">the <rs type="place" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#pla-chan" key="Channel, The">channel</rs> his ancestors by way of the mind are the</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">Greeks and Romans. His page is 
            <choice>
              <sic>burdneed</sic>
              <corr>burdened</corr>
            </choice> with these proofs</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">ofgood breeding--- <rs type="person" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#psn-agrip" key="Agrippa">Henricus Cornelius Agrippa</rs>; <rs type="person" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#psn-suet" key="Suetonius">Suetonius</rs>; <rs type="person" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#psn-plin" key="Pliny">Pliny</rs>, <rs type="person" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#psn-cice" key="Cicero">Cicero</rs>--he quotes them to prove his</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">nobility of mind as we to prove ours quote the</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">Elizabethans. The mummers and the wassailers,</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">the actors who <add hand="typewriter" place="above">were acting</add>who staged their crude dramas in the 
            <choice>
              <sic>churchayrd</sic>
              <corr>churchyard</corr>
            </choice></l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">or in the market place hxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">were sxmxmx   He turns from the present to the past;</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">he ignores the 
            <choice>
              <sic>acors</sic>
              <corr>actors</corr>
            </choice> who were acting their crude

              <corr>dramas</corr>
